reviews.text: I stayed in a non-smoking room for a couple of nights at this very centrally located hotel. Unfortunately the room smelled of old smoke, opening the windows did not help much. One of the evenings internet wasn't working for a couple of hours so I called the support number listed in the room to get help with the connection. Noone answered despite two calls but I later found out the problem affected all of the hotel. Upon check-out I was still charged for these calls to support even though I explained what they were.
reviews.title: Room smelled of smoke

reviews.text: I wanted to boil tea one night but decided not to after taking a look inside the hot water maker..
reviews.title: Everything you would want centrally located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all I think there are better hotels in the same price category.
reviews.title: Make sure you do not pay too much

reviews.text: +Staff friendly
reviews.title: Broken bed in Room 305 - good hotel gone bad

reviews.text: Stayed at First Hotel Vesterbro for three nights during job-related visit to Copenhagen. I stayed in a single room, and found this room larger than other single rooms I have stayed in. Good location, the room was quite spatious and the breakfast was good. The bed was queen size and very comfortable. The nightstand had not been put next to the bed, which I found a bit strange. The biggest drawback was the bathroom (the shower curtain and the drain in particular), which needed a bit of work.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: The bathrooms are old and a bit dirty. They need definetly renovation. Rest of the room is okay and clean. Breakfast buffet was good. Free Wifi in the entire hotel. Restaurant (lunch) was okay as well.
reviews.title: Old bathrooms, rest okay

reviews.text: Decent location in a quiet but fairly central area of the city. The choice of local restaurants was also excellent. Rooms were a good size and clean with all the modern facilities you could need in working order - flatscreen TV, a/c, fridge, kettle, iron, safe, free wifi etc.
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a good location

reviews.text: The staff were all excellent and very friendly.
reviews.title: Excellent customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only gripe was that I booked a twin room and was given a double. This was rectified quickly and without any problems by the reception staff but might have been a problem if the hotel had been fully booked.
reviews.title: Mold in the bathtub...

reviews.text: Stayed at the First Hotel Vesterbro with a friend for 3 nights for our first visit to Copenhagen. The hotel was very well located, 5-10 minute walk to Tivoli Gardens and Central Station. Also quite a number of bars, pubs and restaurants within easy (5-10 minute) walking distance. With a good pair of walking shos you can cover most of Copenhagen on foot. Recommend requesting a room that is not on the street side of the hotel as the traffic would be noisy at night (however the busy road makes it feel very safe when walking home at night) - we were lucky enough to have a room on the non-street side so had absolutely no trouble with noise. Also suggest requesting a room that is not located on top of the restaurant as breakfast commenced at 7am. Couldn't hear the people in adjoining rooms, couldn't hear people in the hall outside. The room itself was basic but very clean. Wood floors, bedding was warm, comfortable and clean, bathroom was basic but clean (although privacy was a bit of an issue as the bathroom walls are thin) - shower over bathtub. Room is smallish but if you are just using for a place to sleep and relax a little in the mornings then the room is more than adequate. Great hanging space for clothes. Breakfast was definitely the highlight (served 7-11 on weekends, 7-10 on weekdays) - although suggest staying away from the scrambled eggs - go for the soft boiled instead. Served in a lovely covered atrium or seats inside if you prefer. Great Danish pastries! Good coffee. Staff were very helpful in renting us hotel bikes 150DKK per day at time of review. Even if you haven't ridden in 10 years (like me) it is a great thing to do in Copenhagen as there are many dedicated bike lanes and all drivers and pedestrians give way. Overall a great experience in Copenhagen at the First Vesterbro Hotel - highly recommend.
reviews.title: Great location, basic but clean, excellent breakfast - definitly recommend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Anna Marie on reception was excellent in her customer service and delivery, pity she works for this hotel. Arrived exhausted following 30 hrs of direct travel from Australia. 2.15pm room not available. Waited in reception, enquired at 2.45pm to discover room had been ready on our arrival but some mix up. First room – air con not working, window opened onto courtyard and latch broken so could not prevent unauthorised entry. Second room - TV not working & air con controls off wall. Third room – bathroom floor flooded through floor vent every time shower used. Was not going to move again so procured numerous bath towels each time to direct water into corridor. Restaurant not open of a night, bar not open Sunday. 2 rooms with big dated TVs, 3rd had flat screen. Whole hotel needs a facelift. Why it considers itself the leading hotel chain in Scandinavia has me beat.
reviews.title: Not Good

reviews.text: In past, I have stayed in Copenhagen Plaza in-front of Tivoli, very good hotel, spacious and good service! This time based in reviews here, i decided to try this one.
reviews.title: No concept of service!

reviews.text: We stayed for 10 days in this hotel, I was working for few days and rest we were exploring Copenhagen.
reviews.title: Crowded, overworked staff and a room that stank

reviews.text: Our room overlooked the street but was still very quite. It was clean and well equiped. Staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast was great, a huge selection of hot and cold foods nicely prepared. The restaurant serves a nice meal although the choice was a bit limited.
reviews.title: Very nice Hotel

reviews.text: The Hotel is well situated for visiting the City, Tivoli is a 10 minute walk and everywhere of interest is easily reached on foot.

reviews.title: Excellent hotel - made our city break an easy stay
